hero_subtitle: You need a Steuernummer (tax number) in order to be self-employed in Germany. You fill in the official form and we send it directly to the Finanzamt (tax office). The registration through Accountable is fast, secure and free of charge
hero_term_2: Receive your tax number from the Finanzamt via mail
faq_raso_q_1_title: Is this the form I‚Äôm looking for?
faq_raso_q_1_answer:
In order to register as self-employed in Germany, you will need to fill out a form called "Fragebogen zur steuerlichen Erfassung" (in English: Tax regulation questionnaire). This is also how you sign up for a Steuernummer (tax number). On our website you find the official form that can be submitted directly to your Finanzamt.

So if you want to become self-employed, you found the right page!
faq_raso_q_2_title: Do I need an Elster account for this?
faq_raso_q_2_answer: You don't need to create an ELSTER account in order to submit the "Fragebogen"! We will submit the form via our official ELSTER interface and spare you the trouble of setting up an ELSTER account.
faq_raso_q_3_title: Will you help me with questions regarding the form?
faq_raso_q_3_answer: Our customer support team is always happy to help. Just drop us your question in the LiveChat or schedule an info call and we'll help you out. You also find a lot of info on our blog!
faq_raso_q_4_title: What to know before filling in the form?
faq_raso_q_4_answer: Before you start filling in the form, make sure you know your Steueridentifikationsnummer (tax ID), you are sure wether you want to register as Kleinunternehmer (small business) and have a raff estimate of what you will make in profit.
faq_raso_q_5_answer: Yes, this form is completely free. You can simply click on "submit" and you'll receive your Steuernummer (tax number) after about 3 weeks by the Finanzamt. Nothing will be charged.
faq_raso_q_6_answer:
Accountable is the simplest and best solution for self-employed professionals.

You can create invoices accepted by the German tax office, scan all your receipts and therefore digitalise your accounting with ease. In addition, Accountable takes care of your tax obligations: whether it's VAT or income tax, with Accountable you won't miss any deadlines. You can send your tax returns directly to your tax office through a secure Elster interface.

Even if you don't know anything about the German tax system, with Accountable you can do everything right from the start. We translate the language of the tax office for you and give you valuable tax tips. Our mission is to make your everyday life as a self-employed professional easier, so that you can concentrate on what is really important.

raso_success_a_section_faq_1_answer:
Accountable is the simplest and best solution for self-employed professionals.

You can create invoices accepted by the German tax office, scan all your receipts and therefore digitalise your accounting with ease. In addition, Accountable takes care of your tax obligations: whether it's VAT or income tax, with Accountable you won't miss any deadlines. You can send your tax returns directly to your tax office through a secure Elster interface.

Even if you don't know anything about the German tax system, with Accountable you can do everything right from the start. We translate the language of the tax office for you and give you valuable tax tips. Our mission is to make your everyday life as a self-employed professional easier, so that you can concentrate on what is really important.
raso_success_a_section_faq_2_title: What is your special offer for the new self-employed?
raso_success_a_section_faq_2_answer:
Everyone who signs up as a self-employed professional through us can use our best PRO version with all features for 6 months completely free of charge.

You don't have to register with your credit card and you don't have to choose a subscription.

We know how difficult it can be to get started, so we want to make it as easy as possible for you. If you like the PRO version, you can decide after the 6 months trial if you want to continue using it. There is no automatic renewal.
raso_success_a_section_faq_3_answer:
You can use Accountable with all features for free in the first 6 months if you take advantage of our special offer for beginners. No credit card is required for this offer. Even after the 6 months, you can use the Accountable app for free at your leisure and for as long as you like.

The free plan allows you to scan up to 5 documents per month. You won't incur any costs and you don't have to sign up for a subscription. If you want to scan more documents, you can switch to our BASIC or PRO plan. You can find out more about our prices here
raso_success_a_section_faq_4_title: Does Accountable work for a Kleinunternehmer?
raso_success_a_section_faq_4_answer:
Yes, we have developed the app especially for self-employed and Kleinunternehmer (small business owners).

As a Kleinunternehmer, you can digitalise and professionalize your accounting with the Accountable app for free. The app automatically adapts to your individual tax situation. As your business grows, we can also help you further with our partner tax advisors.
raso_success_a_section_faq_5_title: Does Accountable replace the need for a tax advisor?
raso_success_a_section_faq_5_answer:
Accountable gives you the freedom to decide how you want to work: Do you want to manage your accounting and taxes on your own? Great! Then use Accountable to save time and focus on what's important.

You like to work with your existing accountant and still want to use Accountable? No problem: You can simply export all transactions with all the receipts for a certain period. Your tax advisor can then give you the best advice based on this information.

If you are looking for a tax advisor but haven't found one yet: You can use the app in cooperation with one of our partnered tax advisors.
raso_success_a_section_faq_6_title: What are my tax obligations as a self-employed in Germany?
raso_success_a_section_faq_6_answer:
In Germany, there are three main types of taxes that might be important for you: VAT (also called sales tax), income tax and trade tax for trade organisations.

All tax obligations for VAT and income tax can be easily done in our app. You can also create the EÜR (income surplus statement) through Accountable and send it directly to your tax office. We remind you of all your tax obligations and help you if you have titles about the tax system in Germany.
raso_success_a_section_faq_7_title: Can Accountable recommend me a tax advisor?
raso_success_a_section_faq_7_answer: Yes, if you want to work with a tax consultant, we have the perfect solution for you. We can forward your request to one of our partnered tax advisors who will help you for pre-determined prices.
raso_success_a_section_faq_8_title: Can I use Accountable if I already have a tax advisor?
raso_success_a_section_faq_8_answer: You like to work with your current Steuerberater or accountant and still want to use Accountable? No problem: You can simply export all transactions with all the receipts for a certain period. Your tax advisor can then advise you optimally based on this information.

gender_helper: Currently, the Finanzamt does not offer "diverse" as a gender. At Accountable, we support all genders.
address_helper_expand_title: What should I do when I recently moved from abroad to Germany?
address_helper_expand_content: Answer "no" as long as you didn't move house within Germany.
address_helper_expand_2_title: I will move in the next weeks. Which address should I put?
address_helper_expand_2_content:
You will receive your tax number via mail. If you are planning on moving house in the next weeks,

you can contact your tax office and change your address.
religion_heper: The religion you are registered with and pay church tax to. If you are not paying church tax, select "nicht kirchensteuerpflichtig".
moved_label: Have you recently moved from another German city in the last 12 months?
moved_helper: This information helps the Finanzamt to correctly match your tax records.
optin_label: I want to receive help filling in the form and tax tips from Accountable.
profession_helper: On the basis of this information, the Finanzamt decides whether you are classified as a Freiberufler or a Gewerbetreibender and what taxes you have to pay. Please find more information here.
profession_helper_expand_title: What should I put in the profession field?
profession_helper_expand_content:
A short but precise description of your profession. For example, not just "design" but something like "creating designs for websites".

You can also register multiple professions. They should all be related to your main profession. As a web designer you could for example also add online advertising and marketing as complementary professions.
officeaddress_label: Do you have an office address?
previousbusiness_label: Have you operated a Gewerbe, worked as a self-employed professional or held shares in a company (of at least 1%) in the last 5 years?
steueridentifkationsnummer_helper: As a German you receive the Steueridentifikationsnummer at birth. As an expat you receive it when you first register in Germany. It is NOT your Steuernummer. If in doubt you can find more information here.
steuernummer_label: Do you or your spouse already have a tax number / Steuernummer?
steuernummer_helper_expand_title: What is my tax identification number?
steuernummer_helper_expand_content: The tax identification number (Steuer-ID; Steueridentifikationsnummer) consists of 11 digits, written like in this example: 12365489753 (Please don‚Äôt confuse with your freelance tax number (Steuernummer), which has this format: 198/113/10010).
steuernummer_helper_2_expand_title: Where do I find my tax identification number?
steuernummer_helper_2_expand_content:
If you‚Äôve been working as an employee you can generally find it on your wage slip (Lohnsteuerbescheinigung) in the top section under ‚ÄúSteuer-ID‚Äù

Your tax identification number is also stated on your income tax assessments.

If you were born in Germany or are registered in the country for tax reasons, you should have received a letter from the tax office assigning you a Steuer-ID. Children receive their tax ID shortly after birth and foreigners are assigned their Steuer-ID when they first register in Germany. Alternatively, if you didn‚Äôt receive a letter or simply can‚Äôt find it, you can request the letter with your Steuer-ID to be sent again using the input form on the website of the BZSt
steuernummer_value_label: Please enter the existing Steuernummer (tax number)
singleentry_label: I want to use the E√úR (simplified profit determination method) for self-employed
singleentry_helper: The Einnahmen√ºberschussrechnung (E√úR) or single entry bookkeeping is the simplified and most common method for self employed professionals. Your taxes are calculated based on the income and expenses you declare.
singleentry_helper_2: We currently only support single entry bookkeeping. Contact us if you want to use another method and/or if you are making over ‚Ç¨600.000 in revenue or ‚Ç¨60.000 in profit.
singleentry_helper_expand_content:
The E√úR (profit & loss statement) is the easiest method to calculate your profit as a self-employed professional. All freelancers and professionals with an annual turnover of less than 600,000‚Ç¨ and an annual profit of less than 60,000‚Ç¨ can use the E√úR.

At the moment we only support registrations with the E√úR. If you want to use another method (e.g. double bookkeeping), please contact our customer service.
startdate_helper_expand_content: You can also register your self-employment retroactively. This can make sense, especially if you already have costs to kick-start your self-employment. However, please note that you may then have to file tax returns for this period.
revenue_firstYear_helper: Please provide an estimate of your revenues from self-employment (without salaries, rental income, interest etc.)
revenue_firstYear_error: According to your estimated revenue of ‚Ç¨{{- estiYrRev}} for your first year, your estimated monthly revenue is ‚Ç¨ {{- projMonRev}}. Your projected annual revenue for a full working year is ‚Ç¨{{- projYrRev}}. As this is above the threshold for the small business owner (Kleinunternehmer) regulation, you will need to charge VAT from your customers
revenue_firstYear_helper_expand_title: Estimated revenue this year and next year
revenue_firstYear_helper_expand_content: Here you should provide a realistic estimate of your income from your planned self-employment. You do not need to add other information, for example from employment.
revenue_firstYear_helper_2_expand_title: Calculation example for a small entrepreneur or side-gig self-employment
revenue_firstYear_helper_2_expand_conten:
Hourly rate: 25‚Ç¨
Working hours per week: 15 hours
Working weeks per year: 40 weeks
Turnover per year: 25‚Ç¨ x 15 hours x 40 weeks = 15.000‚Ç¨.
revenue_firstYear_helper_3_expand_conten:
Daily rate: 300‚Ç¨
Billable days per year: 200 days
Turnover per year: 300‚Ç¨ x 150 days = 60.000‚Ç¨.
revenue_secondYear_helper: Please provide an estimate of your revenues from self-employment (without salaries, rental income, interest etc.)
revenue_secondYear_error: According to your estimated revenue of ‚Ç¨{{- estiYrRev}} for your second year, Your projected annual revenue for a full working year is ‚Ç¨{{- projYrRev}}. As this is above the threshold for the small business owner (Kleinunternehmer) regulation, you will need to charge VAT from your customers
chargeVAT_label: Do you want to be exempt from VAT as a Kleinunternehmer (small business owner)?
chargeVAT_helper: If your yearly revenue is below ‚Ç¨22.000, you are eligible for the small business owner / Kleinunternehmer regime and can decide whether you want to charge VAT. You can find more information on the pros and cons here.
chargeVAT_expand_helper_title: Can I register as a Kleinunternehmer (small business owner)?
chargeVAT_expand_helper_content:
As a Kleinunternehmer your are exempted from VAT if your turnover is less than 22,000‚Ç¨ in the first year and less than 50,000‚Ç¨ in the following year (as of 2021).

If you start your business in the middle of the year, don't forget that the 22,000‚Ç¨ are meant for the whole year. For example, if you register on July 1st, you can only have a maximum turnover of 11,000‚Ç¨ for the first year.
chargeVAT_expand_helper_2_title: Is the small business regulation (Kleinunternehmerregelung) always a good option?
chargeVAT_expand_helper_2_content:
The exemption from VAT is a good option if you only have private individuals as customers and do not have high investments.

However, if you mainly have business customers or if you are planning to make high investments, this regulation is usually not worthwhile. As a small business owner (Kleinunternehmer), you cannot reclaim the VAT paid on your expenses.
askVATnumber_label: Request VAT number - only needed for charging clients that are in the EU but outside Germany
askVATnumber_helper: If you are not planning to invoice customers in other EU countries (not including Germany) you can use your Steuernummer for German clients. You can find more information on the european VAT number here.
askVATnumber_expand_helper_title: Do I need a VAT ID?
askVATnumber_expand_helper_content:
You only need one if you do business with EU companies. Kleinunternehmer (small business owners) usually don't need one.

Also if you only sell to private individuals in the EU, you do not need a VAT ID. The same applies if you only have German customers.
profitFreiberufler_label: Are you expecting profit from self-employment (Freiberufler)?
profitFreiberufler_expand_helper_title: What is the difference between profit from self-employment and profit from commercial operations?
profitFreiberufler_expand_helper_content:
Self-employed activities include:
- freelance activities (Freiberufler)
- state lottery income
- sother self-employed activities (e.g. asset management)

All other activities are usually gewerblich (commercial). You can also check our blog for more information.
profitFreiberufler_expand_helper_2_title: How do I estimate my profit?
profitFreiberufler_expand_helper_2_conte:
You can subtract your estimated expenses from your expected income and calculate your profit. No worries, the Finanzamt does not expect a perfect prediction of your profit.

Based on your estimate, the tax office will determine the advance tax payments. With your tax return at the end of the year you will be refunded or you have to pay more taxes, based on how much you really earned.
profitFreiberuflerFirstYear_helper: Estimate the profit you will be making as best as you can. Profit is the amount you are expecting to earn after deducting work related expenses (e.g. Tools, transportation, software, training, etc...).
profitFirstYear_helper: Estimate the profit you will be making as best as you can. Profit is the amount you are expecting to earn after deducting work related expenses (e.g. Tools, transportation, software, training, etc...).
profit_expand_helper_title: What is the difference between profit from self-employment and profit from commercial operations?
profit_expand_helper_content:
Self-employed activities include:
- freelance activities (Freiberufler)
- state lottery income
- sother self-employed activities (e.g. asset management)

All other activities are usually gewerblich (commercial). You can also check our blog for more information.
profit_expand_helper_2_title: How do I estimate my profit?
profit_expand_helper_2_content:
You can subtract your estimated expenses from your expected income and calculate your profit. No worries, the Finanzamt does not expect a perfect prediction of your profit.

Based on your estimate, the tax office will determine the advance tax payments. With your tax return at the end of the year you will be refunded or you have to pay more taxes, based on how much you really earned.
freiberufler_oder_gewerbetreibender_labe: Will these profits come from freelance self-employment (Freiberufler) pr commercial operations (Gewerbetreibender)
profitGewerbetreibender_label: Are you expecting profit from commercial operations (Gewerbetreibender)?
profitGewerbetreibenderSecondYear_helper: Estimate the profit you will be making as best as you can. Profit is the amount you are expecting to earn after deducting work related expenses (e.g. Tools, transportation, software, training, etc...).
profitNichtselbstandiger_helper: If you receive a salary, please enter your gross annual salary for the entire year, before any tax and social insurance deductions.
profitKapitalvermogen_label: Are you expecting profit from investments (Kapitalverm√∂gen)
profitKapitalvermogen_helper: Profit from stock market, bonds or interests (Not rental income)
profitVermietung_label: Are you expecting income from rental and leasing (Vermietung und Verpachtung)?
profitVermietung_helper: Profit from letting and leasing properties, for example renting out an apartment
profitSonstigen_label: Are you expecting Income from other sources (Sonstigen Eink√ºnften)?
profitAgriculture_label: Do you have income from agriculture and forestry (Land und Forstwirtschaft)?
profitAgriculture_helper: Currently we don‚Äôt support the automatic sign up for tax IDs if you have income from agriculture and forestry. Contact us if it was the case.
taxPrepayment_label: Do you want to estimate your costs to lower your tax prepayments?
taxPrepayment_helper: You can try to estimate your costs based on your last income tax return. Choose ‚ÄòNo‚Äô if you are not sure - This might increase your income tax prepayments, but you can deduct those expenses at the end of the year and you are on the safe side.
tax_estimate_sonderausgaben_fieldset_tit: Expected amount of private special expenses (Sonderausgaben)
tax_estimate_sonderausgaben_fieldset_hel: Private insurances, pension savings, donations, etc... Should not include normal business expenses like office supplies and tools.
tax_estimate_steuerabzugsbetrage_fieldse: You can try to estimate based on your last income tax return under ‚ÄúSteuerabzugsbetr√§ge‚Äù.
tax_estimate_form_warning: One of these categories has to be filled:

businessIban_label: IBAN of your business bank account

taxOffice_helper: Pick the Finanzamt that serves your neighbourhood.
taxOffice_helper_2: You can find it here by using your zip code or city name.

review_button_success_heading: After submitting the form you will receive your tax number from the Finanzamt via post. It usually takes 3-6 weeks to arrive.
review_button_success_subtitle: For extra peace of mind, you can ask your tax consultant on our website to review your tax registration form before submitting it to the Finanzamt.
disclaimer: The guidance provided within this form is without liability and does not replace a tax consultant. To get an accurate answer for your specific case, please consult with a certified tax consultant.
consent_message: By clicking the "Continue" button, you expressly agree to the Accountable Terms of Use and understand that my account information will be used according to Accountable Privacy Policy.
